result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin D Tarrant was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Possession with Intent to Deliver/Distribute a Controlled Substance On or Near a School

- AODA and any follow-up

- All prescriptions are to be used as prescribed and according to the prescription directions.
- Defendant is to notify his agent within 24 hours of any prescription.
- Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.

Victim Notice of Rights sent to Joshua G. has been returned.  Return to sender.  Note Deliverable as addressed.  Unable to Forward.  (CONFIDENTIAL)
of hearing held on November 3, 2015, before Hon Mark T. Slate - Circuit Court Judge, by Brenda L. Sosinsky - Court Reporter
Releasing Funds - $250.00 to Clerk of Courts
Miscellaneous

2:10 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Ryan Ulrich.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Ulrich has received a copy of the presentence investigation report, with no corrections, additions or deletions.  State has received a copy of the presentence investigation report, with no corrections, additions or deletions.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing argument by DA.  Sentencing argument by Atty Ulrich.  Statement by defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

5 years of Initial Confinement and 3 years of Extended Supervision

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:

-Court costs
-AODA and any follow-up
-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
-All prescriptions are to be used as prescribed and according to the prescription directions.
-Defendant is to notify his agent within 24 hours of any prescription.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.

Court grants the defendant 105 days of sentence credit.

Court finds the defendant not eligible for the CIP program and eligible for the SAP program.

Sentence is to commence immediately.

Court adjourned at 2:53 p.m.

Order for Presentence Investigation Report has been returned.  Return to sender.  Attempted - not Known.  Unable to Forward.

1:38 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Ryan Ulrich.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to count 2 in 2014CF112 with no enhancers and the balance of the counts and other cases including FDL 2014CM876 will be dismissed and read-in.  State concurs.  Atty Ulrich concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty to count 2 on 2014CF112.  Court strikes the enhancers.  Court orders count 1 on 2014CF112 and all other cases be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Court orders a presentence investigation be completed and filed with the court in 60 days.  Court sets for sentencing on September 21, 2015 at 2:00 p.m.

15CF63 - defendant is to complete processing.

Court adjourned at 1:45 p.m.
Sentencing hearing at 09-21-2015 02:00 pm

1:04 p.m.  State by DA Andrew Christenson.  Defendant present, in custody, without an attorney.

2014CM169 - 2014CF112
Defendant has filed a request for bond modification.  Defendant states he is waiting for Public Defender to appoint counsel.  Court instructs defendant of his right to an attorney - defendant waives this right - court accepts the waiver for today's hearing.  Argument by the defendant.  

Defendant states he believes he has the right to a speedy trial on 2014CM169.  Defendant requests a speedy trial on 2014CM169.  Court will so schedule for trial and to be held within the next sixty days.  

Defendant requests a speedy trial on 2014CF112 as well..  Court will so schedule for trial and to be held within the next ninety days.

Statement by the defendant regarding his request for bond modification.  Argument by DA - objects to the request.  Further statement by the defendant.  Court converts 2014CM169 to a $250.00 signature bond with all ordered conditions to remain.  Court denies request on 2014CF112.
